subject: Critical Thinking
title: Intellectual Humility: The Master Debiaser
description: One-minute skill: Intellectual Humility: The Master Debiaser.

hook.text: The smartest thinkers in history shared one trait: they knew how much they didn't know. Socrates made it famous.

buildup.text: Intellectual humility: recognizing that your beliefs might be wrong and being willing to revise them.

discovery.text: Studies show intellectually humble people learn faster, make better predictions, and maintain better relationships.

twist.text: Humility isn't weakness. It's confidence â€” the confidence to admit error without feeling threatened.

climax.text: In a world of loud certainty, intellectual humility is a competitive advantage that almost nobody cultivates.

punchline.text: The wisest words: 'I might be wrong.'

quiz.question: What is intellectual humility?
options: Recognizing your beliefs might be wrong and being willing to revise them
